name: North Downs Day Ranger (Reading-Guildford-Redhill)
description: NORTH DOWNS DAY RANGER Unlimited travel with weekday time restrictions for one day between Reading, Guildford and Redhill.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 2nd Mar 2025 One day ranger adult: £22.00 child (5-15): £11.00 16-17 saver: £11.00 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H V N : £14.65 FF H V N child fare: £4.40 Valid railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends H = HM Forces V = Veterans N = Network Card Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult): 2024 - £21.00 2023 - £20.00 2022 - £19.00 2021 - £18.00 2020 - £18.00 2019 - £17.50 2018 - £17.10 2014 - £15.50 2011 - £13.00 time restrictions Mon to Fri: valid from 09:00 or from when the off-peak day return becomes valid if earlier but 2T railcard not valid until 09:30 and NW railcard not valid until 10:00 No restrictions at weekends or bank holidays train operating companies Great Western Railway purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine: i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London King's Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities

stations: Dorking West Earley Farnborough North Gomshall
